bug.author: Szpaqn
bug.summary: The visual Observation 0 of the model does not match.
bug.description:
Hi, I am trying to train an agent to play a game (for my bachelor thesis). I wanted to use visual observations. I was using them in a different project, with ML-Agents 0.3 and all worked fine. Now in version ML-Agents 0.6, when I try to use the produced .bytes file as a model for my brain, I get:
Any idea what I am doing wrong? <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16925848/50538065-9f15fa00-0b69-11e9-8c28-e08a83c74174.jpg></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16925848/50538066-a210ea80-0b69-11e9-855b-ea88e3f1ec0e.jpg></denchmark-link>

comments.comment: Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Szpaqn>@Szpaqn</denchmark-link> , I've been able to replicate your issue, and we'll look into this. In the meantime, using a square observation should avoid this issue.

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Szpaqn>@Szpaqn</denchmark-link> , we've diagnosed the issue and it's a bug purely in the warning message; it will be fixed soon. Feel free to ignore the warning and use inference anyways, the actual model load works.

Hi, <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ervteng>@ervteng</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/vincentpierre>@vincentpierre</denchmark-link> , thank you for your information. I've checked and it works fine.
This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
